Conformance Criteria - 1. Mark pipe route by markers set flush inground above.
2. Markers shall by minimum 200 x 200 x 50thick concrete slab with a brass plate fixed to top surface engraved: "FUEL PIPES UNDER" and directional arrows to indicate route.
3. Marker Installation: Install at maximum 15m intervals and at all changes in direction. (Pipe Markers are not required where pipe route is covered by a concrete slab)

Conformance Criteria - 1. Pressure test to 1.5 times working pressure or not less than 350kPa
Primary pipe Pre-Pipework Pressure Testing Inspection
Referenced Documentation - NZT5007-STE-SPC-ELEC-0001, AES-NZ1005-STE-DSH-ELE-0002, PLX installation Guide
Conformance Criteria - 1. Conduct a visual inspection of pipework to be tested, checking all connections to ensure they are tight.
2. Ensure all valves in the system are in the correct position and tagged “DO NOT OPEN” or “DO NOT CLOSE”
3. Secondary containment pipe work shall be open to atmosphere

4. Test heads are fixed to transition fittings (at the dispenser) to allow pressure to be introduced and for the internal pressure to be measured. The other end (at the tank) must be closed off using spade connections between the compact flange/ flange connections to ensure that the tank is both isolated and that the pressure test is not also being applied to the tank.
5. All installation Hold Points have been signed off by CPB & AECOM prior to pressure testing commencing
Referenced Documentation - NZT5007-STE-SPC-ELEC-0001, AES-NZ1005-STE-DSH-ELE-0002, PLX installation Guide
Conformance Criteria - 1. Introduce air/nitrogen to an initial V pressure of 0.5bar (10psi).
• Examine all the electrofusion joints and threaded joints for any leakage using soap solution (where possible).
Referenced Documentation - NZT5007-STE-SPC-ELEC-0001, AES-NZ1005-STE-DSH-ELE-0002, PLX installation Guide
Conformance Criteria - The pressure may then be raised in 0.5bar increments over 15 minute intervals to a maximum pressure of 4.0bar (60psi)
• Once the target pressure is reached, measurements should be taken from the pressure gauge:
– The minimum duration of test shall be 1 hour.
Pipework Pressure Testing (Line Test Data Sheet)
Referenced Documentation - MEL Line test data sheet
Conformance Criteria - 1. Complete pressure test to verify no leaks and complete Line Test Data Sheet.
Pressure testing procedure for the secondary containment lines
Referenced Documentation - NZT5007-STE-SPC-ELEC-0001, AES-NZ1005-STE-DSH-ELE-0002, PLX Installation Guide
Conformance Criteria - Introduce air to an initial pressure of 0.5bar (10psi).
• Examine all the electrofusion joints and threaded joints for any leakage using soap solution (where possible).
• The pressure may then be raised in 0.5bar increments over 15 minute intervals to a maximum pressure of 2.0bar (30psi).
• Once the target pressure is reached, measurements should be taken from the pressure gauge:
– The minimum duration of test shall be 1 hour.

Schedule WCT 12 Penetrations - CPB Hold Point

Conformance Criteria - All penetrations from and between secure areas, above and below ground, are less than 125mm in at least one plane, and in circular ducts no greater than 225mm in diameter (or have high tensile steel bars to reduce the aperture to no greater than 125mm in at least one plane).
